attributes.action: Provide scientific evidence to support exclusion of animal sentience from UK law
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/home-news/brexit-bill-latest-animal-sentience-cannot-feel-pain-emotion-vote-mps-agree-eu-withdrawal-bill-a8064676.html

https://www.legislation.gov.uk/ukpga/2006/45/contents

https://www.legislation.gov.uk/ukpga/2006/45/section/1

Correspondence requesting further information from "the relevant national authority" (Secretary of State Damian Green MP) has been issued and is awaiting a response.
attributes.background: We demand that the government provides evidence from at least five separate and credible scientific studies to support their exclusion of animal sentience from post-Brexit law. The claim that it was covered by the Animal Welfare act 2006 is untrue and unacceptable. Government opinion is not fact.
